content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})
    result = Vector{String}(undef, length(strings))
    @threads for i in eachindex(strings)
        word = strings[i]
        if !isempty(word)
            vowels = ["a", "e", "i", "o", "u"]
            suffix = "ay"
            if !isalpha(word[end])
                suffix = word[end]*suffix
                word = word[1:end-1]
            end
            if findfirst(isequal, lowercase(word)) === nothing
                word = word[2:end]*word[1]
            end
            if findfirst(isequal, lowercase(word[1])) === nothing
                word = word*suffix
            else
                word = word*"way"
            end
        end
        result[i] = word
    end
    return result
end
```

Please note that Julia's threading model depends on the underlying LLVM implementation and the `@threads` macro may not always result in parallel execution. It's recommended to refer to the official Julia documentation for guidance on effective parallel programming.
